array.string: icon
icon-60
If you want the rainbow, you gotta put up with the rain.\nDolly Rebecca Parton
You’ll never find a rainbow if you’re looking down.\nCharlie Chaplin
I always like walking in the rain, so no one can see me crying.\nCharlie Chaplin
Some people feel the rain. Others just get wet.\nBob Marley
If you can dream it, you can do it.\nWalt Disney
Laughter is timeless. Imagination has no age. And dreams are forever.\nWalt Disney
Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently.\nHenry Ford
Time is the scarcest resource and unless it is managed nothing else can be managed.\nPeter Drucker
The entrepreneur always searches for change, responds to it, and exploits it as an opportunity.\nPeter Drucker
Efficiency is doing things right; effectiveness is doing the right things.\nPeter Drucker
Until we're educating every kid in a fantastic way, until every inner city is cleaned up, there is no shortage of things to do.\nBill Gates
Life is not fair -- get used to it.\nBill Gates
If you want to make an apple pie from scratch, you must first create the universe.\nCarl Sagan
The first principle is that you must not fool yourself - and you are the easiest person to fool.\nRichard Feynman
Do not pray for easy lives. Pray to be stronger men.\nJohn F. Kennedy
The art challenges the technology, and the technology inspires the art.\nJohn Lasseter
Only when the tide goes out do you discover who's been swimming naked.\nWarren Buffett
Price is what you pay. Value is what you get.\nWarren Buffett
Someone's sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago.\nWarren Buffett
We simply attempt to be fearful when others are greedy and to be greedy only when others are fearful.\nWarren Buffett
The best customer service is if the customer doesn't need to call you, doesn't need to talk to you. It just works.\nJeff Bezos
Stay hungry, stay foolish.\nSteve Jobs
I want to put a ding in the universe.\nSteve Jobs
Design is not just what it looks like and feels like.\nDesign is how it works.\nSteve Jobs
The best way to predict the future is to invent it.\nAlan Kay
Life is a great big canvas.\nThrow all the paint on it you can.\nDanny Kaye
If I'd asked customers what they wanted, they would have said "a faster horse".\nHenry Ford
A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.\nAlbert Einstein
Gravitation is not responsible for people falling in love.\nAlbert Einstein
The true sign of intelligence is not knowledge but imagination.\nAlbert Einstein
If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.\nAlbert Einstein
Before God we are all equally wise - and equally foolish.\nAlbert Einstein

I believe life is a series of near misses. A lot of what we ascribe to luck is not luck at all. It's seizing the day and accepting responsibility for your future. It's seeing what other people don't see And pursuing that vision.\nHoward Schultz
There are no road signs to help navigate. And, in fact, no one has yet determined which side of the road we're supposed to be on.\nSteve Case
Great CEOs are not just born with shiny hair and a tie.\nMarc Andreessen
The most important thing in communication is hearing what isn't said.\nPeter Drucker
Effective leadership is not about making speeches or being liked; leadership is defined by results not attributes.\nPeter Drucker
Intellectual property has the shelf life of a banana.\nBill Gates
We live in a society exquisitely dependent on science and technology, in which hardly anyone knows anything about science and technology.\nCarl Sagan

We are at the very beginning of time for the human race. It is not unreasonable that we grapple with problems. But there are tens of thousands of years in the future. Our responsibility is to do what we can, learn what we can, improve the solutions, and pass them on.\nRichard Feynman
When a man cannot choose, he ceases to be a man.\nStanley Kubrick
I discovered that if one looks a little closer at this beautiful world, there are always red ants underneath.\nDavid Lynch
Change is the law of life. And those who look only to the past or present are certain to miss the future.\nJohn F. Kennedy

I strongly believe that missionaries make better products. They care more. For a missionary, it's not just about the business. There has to be a business, and the business has to make sense, but that's not why you do it. You do it because you have something meaningful that motivates you.\nJeff Bezos
We keep moving forward, opening new doors, and doing new things, because we're curious and curiosity keeps leading us down new paths.\nWalt Disney
The more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.\nWalt Disney
All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.\nWalt Disney

You can't connect the dots looking forward; you can only connect them looking backwards.
So you have to trust that the dots will somehow connect in your future.
You have to trust in something - your gut, destiny, life, karma, whatever.
This approach has never let me down, and it has made all the difference in my life.
Steve Jobs

You have to trust in something - your gut, destiny, life, karma, whatever.
